page.title: 14HOUSING. BUILDINGS.
page.content: {Berkswell}has a variety of houses spanning several centuries.Timber & plaster cottages standing among bungalows & houses built in the 1970's.{Berkswell Hall,}built in 1800, set in its own park with 2 lodges & lake.The Wheatley family lived there from 1880 until sold in 1985.The Hall is now being converted into luxury apartments.The{Well House}built in the 1720's once the Rectory, also the home of Maud Watson the 1st Ladies Singles Champion at Wimbledon,1884.Today the home of the Jagger family who keep the tennis tradition alive with a court in the garden.{The Moat House,}a Victorian mansion now divided into 3 units, originally it had 25 bedrooms. The moat still partly exists. A ghost is believed to leave a book of poems on the floor every time it calls.
